artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Author: Kikubatei Rokō; Publisher: Daikokuya Kinnosuke
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 134.8; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 288.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: pair of figures wrestling in foreground--a man wearing predominately green armor and a brown-skinned demon-like figure; demon seated in background at left wearing yellow garment, with a droopy face with open mouth and a second face on stomach, with PL arm stretched upward; grey silhouettes of skeletons against black ground; blue and yellow flowered curtain at right; yellow and white patterned flooring in foreground
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From One Hundred Tales from Japan and China (Wakan hyaku monogatari 和漢百物語)
signed: 一魁斎芳年画 {Ikkaisai Yoshitoshi ga}
title: Toki Daishirō
